Introduction.description: SQL is a standard language for storing, manipulating, and retrieving data in databases.
Introduction.notes: SQL stands for Structured Query Language.

Database Concepts.description: Databases store data in tables, which consist of rows and columns.
Database Concepts.notes: Each table should have a primary key.

SQL Syntax.description: SQL syntax is the set of rules for writing SQL statements.
SQL Syntax.notes: SQL keywords are not case sensitive.

SELECT Statement.description: The SELECT statement is used to select data from a database.
SELECT Statement.output: All rows from the users table.

WHERE Clause.description: The WHERE clause is used to filter records.
WHERE Clause.notes: WHERE is used with SELECT, UPDATE, DELETE.

ORDER BY.description: ORDER BY is used to sort the result set.
ORDER BY.example: SELECT * FROM users ORDER BY name ASC;

Joins.description: Joins are used to combine rows from two or more tables.
Joins.example: SELECT users.name, orders.amount FROM users JOIN orders ON users.id = orders.user_id;

Group By.description: GROUP BY groups rows that have the same values.
Group By.example: SELECT COUNT(*), country FROM users GROUP BY country;

Subqueries.description: A subquery is a query within another query.
Subqueries.example: SELECT name FROM users WHERE id IN (SELECT user_id FROM orders);
Subqueries.notes: Subqueries can be used in SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE.

SQL Functions.description: SQL functions perform operations on data.
SQL Functions.notes: Common functions: COUNT, SUM, AVG, MIN, MAX.

SQL Data Types.description: SQL data types define the type of value a column can hold.
SQL Data Types.notes: Choose the right data type for each column.
